I recently stumbled on a term that was brought up in a few conversations related to Jetpack Compose. It's being referred to as the ‚ÄúDonut Hole‚Äù optimization. The name certainly intrigued me enough to go down the rabbit hole, or in this case, the donut hole üç© Given how early we are in the Jetpack Compose journey, I think it would be valuable to cover some basic concepts to get everyone at the same baseline.

Recomposition

Recomposition is the process of calling your composable functions again when inputs change

At a high level, anytime the inputs or the state of a Composable function changes, it would be valuable for the function to be invoked again. This reactive behavior is critical to how Jetpack Compose functions and is also what makes it so powerful. If I were to oversimplify this, people who are familiar with classic Android View system might remember a method called invalidate to redraw the view on the screen.
